comments:
For wtp-R-1.0.1-200602171228.zip:
Create new ear application, in my sample for a JBoss4 (using the new WTP plugin). 
On the project facets page click on "Show runtimes". In the listbox "Runtime composition" the text "org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.runtime.jboss 4.0" is displayed, and an exception is found in the log (see below). I will attach a screenshot, too.

I sent this issue by mail to Gorkem Ercan on 23. January, but it must have gotten lost, so this report.

Content of ".log":

Created an attachment (id=35081)
Screenshot of the "project facets" page

Tim,

I am not sure what was changed to make this stop working. Was there any change in the relationship of plugins that define the server runtimes with the jst.server.ui plugin? Note that this happens with Tomcat as well.
org.eclipse.jst.server.ui needs to be in the manifest for the plugins with this dependancy. For some reason Eclipse is not currently flagging this as an error during development.
Bug is still there in 1.0.2 RC1 (from file wtp-R-1.0.2RC1-200604070459.zip).
Defer this unless we need WTP 1.0.2 RC3.

Here's the only checkin with 128836 in the description.  I can't say I understand the branching/tagging mechanism, but it appears that it was only released to 1.5.

Update of /cvsroot/webtools/jst/components/server/plugins/org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.ui/META-INF
In directory node2:/tmp/cvs-serv9504/META-INF

Modified Files:
	MANIFEST.MF
Log Message:
[128836] Add missing dependancy

Index: MANIFEST.MF
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvsroot/webtools/jst/components/server/plugins/org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.ui/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF,v
retrieving revision 1.9
retrieving revision 1.10
diff -C2 -d -r1.9 -r1.10
*** MANIFEST.MF	31 Jan 2006 16:11:54 -0000	1.9
--- MANIFEST.MF	7 Mar 2006 02:45:40 -0000	1.10
***************
*** 21,24 ****
--- 21,25 ----
   org.eclipse.wst.server.ui,
   org.eclipse.jst.server.core,
+  org.eclipse.jst.server.ui,
   org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core
  Eclipse-AutoStart: true

This is a minor UI issue and not blocking any function, so we cannot respin the 1.0.2 build. Deferring to 1.5.

Tomcat is working fine - the problem is that the change didn't make it into the generic server definition and websphere plugins. Gorkem - Please add org.eclipse.jst.server.ui to the Require-Bundle section of the manifests of these two plugins for WTP 1.5.
This is fixed when the generic server plugins are split. Closing.
Works with 1.5 RC5 for JBoss 3/4 plugins. Thanks for fixing it.
